description: Thomas Somerville, Professor Emeritus of Music at Occidental College and Minister of Music Emeritus at First Congregational Church of Los Angeles, died peacefully on February 25, 2020, after a long battle with Alzheimer's. Thomas was director of choral activities at Occidental College from 1977 to 2000, where he also served as chairman of the Music...
text:
Thomas Somerville, Professor Emeritus of Music at Occidental College and
Minister of Music Emeritus at First Congregational Church of Los Angeles, died
peacefully on February 25, 2020, after a long battle with Alzheimer's. Thomas
was director of choral activities at Occidental College from 1977 to 2000,
where he also served as chairman of the Music Department, teaching conducting
and music literature, and directing the Occidental College Glee Club. He
earned his MM and DMA degrees at the University of Southern California and was
a member of the faculty of the USC Department of Choral and Church Music from
1972 to 1977. From 1987 to 2007, Thomas was director and associate teacher of
the Oregon Bach Festival-University of Oregon Master Class in Choral and
Orchestral Conducting. He served as minister of music at many churches in
Illinois, North Carolina, Puerto Rico, and California. He directed honor
choirs and served as adjudicator for numerous musical festivals. Prior to
becoming professor of choral activities at St. Andrews Presbyterian College in
North Carolina in 1965, he studied privately with Margaret Hillis in Chicago,
and was a professional member of the Chicago Symphony Orchestra Chorus. In
2009, Thomas and his wife, Virginia, retired to "The Covington" in Aliso
Viejo, California, and founded the first-ever Covington Chorus. Dr. Tom was
the proud father of two sons and two grandchildren, and the loving husband of
Virginia for sixty-two years.

title: Thomas Somerville 1934-2020
html: Thomas Somerville, Professor Emeritus of Music at Occidental College and Minister of Music Emeritus at First Congregational Church of Los Angeles, died peacefully on February 25, 2020, after a long battle with Alzheimer's. Thomas was director of choral activities at Occidental College from 1977 to 2000, where he also served as chairman of the Music Department, teaching conducting and music literature, and directing the Occidental College Glee Club. He earned his MM and DMA degrees at the University of Southern California and was a member of the faculty of the USC Department of Choral and Church Music from 1972 to 1977. From 1987 to 2007, Thomas was director and associate teacher of the Oregon Bach Festival-University of Oregon Master Class in Choral and Orchestral Conducting. He served as minister of music at many churches in Illinois, North Carolina, Puerto Rico, and California. He directed honor choirs and served as adjudicator for numerous musical festivals. Prior to becoming professor of choral activities at St. Andrews Presbyterian College in North Carolina in 1965, he studied privately with Margaret Hillis in Chicago, and was a professional member of the Chicago Symphony Orchestra Chorus. In 2009, Thomas and his wife, Virginia, retired to "The Covington" in Aliso Viejo, California, and founded the first-ever Covington Chorus. Dr. Tom was the proud father of two sons and two grandchildren, and the loving husband of Virginia for sixty-two years.
